abstract: The European Central Bank said volatility appeared to be returning after a period of stability, and the O.E.C.D. warned of “ominous” risks to the global economic outlook.
snippet: The European Central Bank said volatility appeared to be returning after a period of stability, and the O.E.C.D. warned of “ominous” risks to the global economic outlook.
lead_paragraph: PARIS, Sept. 5 — The European Central Bank said Wednesday that volatility in credit markets appeared to be returning after a brief period of stability, and a leading group of advanced economic nations warned of “ominous” new risks to the global economic outlook.

headline.main: New Concerns in Europe About Credit Fallout
headline.print_headline: New Concern in Europe About Credit Fallout

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development

abstract: Citing new economic uncertainties, the bank left its key interest rate unchanged at 4 percent, shifting course from a month ago when it signaled it would raise the rate.
snippet: Citing new economic uncertainties, the bank left its key interest rate unchanged at 4 percent, shifting course from a month ago when it signaled it would raise the rate.
lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Sept. 6 — As Europe continues to absorb shock waves from the crisis in the American mortgage market, leading financial figures here are starting to acknowledge that the turmoil could have a lingering effect on European banks and on broader economic prospects.

headline.main: Cautious European Bank Leaves Rates Unchanged
